description.zh-cn: 对日本明治维新时期三位维新派代表人物木户孝允、西乡隆盛、大久保利通的并称。
description.en: A collective term for the three representative figures of the Restoration faction during the Meiji Restoration in Japan: Kido Takayoshi, Saigō Takamori, and Ōkubo Toshimichi.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治维新时期的政治家，维新三杰之一。
description.en: A Japanese statesman during the Meiji Restoration and one of the Three Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治维新时期的政治家，维新三杰之一。
description.en: A Japanese statesman during the Meiji Restoration and one of the Three Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治维新时期的政治家，维新三杰之一。
description.en: A Japanese statesman during the Meiji Restoration and one of the Three Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪后期日本的一系列政治、经济和社会改革，旨在使日本现代化并建立中央集权政府。
description.en: A series of political, economic, and social reforms in late 19th-century Japan aimed at modernizing the country and establishing a centralized government.

description.zh-cn: 位于东亚的国家。
description.en: A country in East Asia.

description.zh-cn: 日本江户时代末期的一种政治口号和运动，意为“尊崇天皇，驱逐夷狄”。
description.en: A political slogan and movement in late Edo period Japan, meaning 'Revere the Emperor, expel the barbarians'.

description.zh-cn: 指日本德川幕府，在明治维新中被推翻。
description.en: Refers to the Tokugawa shogunate in Japan, which was overthrown during the Meiji Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 明治维新后建立的日本中央政府。
description.en: The central government of Japan established after the Meiji Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 明治政府推行的一项社会改革政策，旨在废除传统的士农工商阶级制度。
description.en: A social reform policy implemented by the Meiji government to abolish the traditional four-class system of warriors, farmers, artisans, and merchants.

description.zh-cn: 明治政府颁布的法令，禁止除军人和警察外的日本人带刀。
description.en: An edict issued by the Meiji government prohibiting Japanese people, other than military and police personnel, from carrying swords.

description.zh-cn: 明治政府用现代的府县制取代传统封建藩国制度的政治改革。
description.en: A political reform by the Meiji government that replaced the traditional feudal domain system (han) with the modern prefectural system (ken).

description.zh-cn: 明治初期日本派往美国和欧洲的 дипломатическая миссия。
description.en: A Japanese diplomatic mission to the United States and Europe in the early Meiji period.

description.zh-cn: 明治初期关于是否应出兵朝鲜的重大政治辩论。
description.en: A major political debate in early Meiji Japan over whether to invade Korea.

description.zh-cn: 对在明治维新中作出重要贡献的十位志士的并称。
description.en: A collective term for ten patriots who made significant contributions to the Meiji Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕末时期的武士、政治家，维新十杰之一。
description.en: A samurai and statesman of the late Edo period in Japan, one of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕末明治维新期的军事家、学者，维新十杰之一。
description.en: A military strategist and scholar of the late Edo and Meiji Restoration periods in Japan, one of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕末时期的长州藩士，明治时代的政治家，维新十杰之一。
description.en: A samurai of the Chōshū Domain during the late Edo period and a statesman of the Meiji era, one of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕末时期的长州藩士，明治时代的政治家，维新十杰之一。
description.en: A samurai of the Chōshū Domain during the late Edo period and a statesman of the Meiji era, one of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕末时期的佐贺藩士，明治时代的政治家，维新十杰之一。
description.en: A samurai of the Saga Domain during the late Edo period and a statesman of the Meiji era, one of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕末、明治维新时期的思想家、政治家，维新十杰之一。
description.en: A thinker and statesman of the late Edo and Meiji Restoration periods in Japan, one of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕末至明治时代的政治家，维新十杰之一。
description.en: A statesman from the late Edo period to the Meiji era in Japan, one of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 幕末时期日本长州藩秘密派往英国留学的五位年轻藩士。
description.en: Five young samurai from the Chōshū Domain in Japan who were secretly sent to study in the United Kingdom during the late Edo period.

description.zh-cn: 日本近代政治家，长州五杰之一，首任日本内阁总理大臣。
description.en: A modern Japanese statesman, one of the Chōshū Five, and the first Prime Minister of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治时代的政治家、技术官僚，长州五杰之一。
description.en: A statesman and technocrat of the Meiji era in Japan, one of the Chōshū Five.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治时代的武士、技术官僚，长州五杰之一，被称为“日本铁道之父”。
description.en: A samurai and technocrat of the Meiji era in Japan, one of the Chōshū Five, known as the 'Father of Japanese Railways'.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治时代的政治家、企业家，长州五杰之一。
description.en: A statesman and entrepreneur of the Meiji era in Japan, one of the Chōshū Five.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治时代的官员，长州五杰之一。
description.en: An official of the Meiji era in Japan, one of the Chōshū Five.

description.zh-cn: 木户孝允是维新三杰的成员之一。
description.en: Kido Takayoshi was one of the members of the Three Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 西乡隆盛是维新三杰的成员之一。
description.en: Saigō Takamori was one of the members of the Three Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通是维新三杰的成员之一。
description.en: Ōkubo Toshimichi was one of the members of the Three Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 维新三杰是明治维新时期的三位核心代表人物，极大地推动了该运动。
description.en: The Three Great Nobles were the three core representative figures of the Meiji Restoration period and greatly promoted the movement.

description.zh-cn: 维新派以“尊皇攘夷”为口号，推动了旨在推翻幕府的明治维新运动。
description.en: The Restoration faction used the slogan 'Sonnō jōi' to promote the Meiji Restoration movement aimed at overthrowing the shogunate.

description.zh-cn: 明治维新运动推翻了日本的幕府统治。
description.en: The Meiji Restoration movement overthrew the shogunate rule in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 明治维新运动成功后，建立了新的明治政府。
description.en: After the success of the Meiji Restoration movement, the new Meiji government was established.

description.zh-cn: 木户孝允首先担任明治政府的实质执政者。
description.en: Kido Takayoshi was the first de facto ruler of the Meiji government.

description.zh-cn: 在多数政府要员出访欧美期间，西乡隆盛担任留守，成为第二位实质执政者。
description.en: While many senior government officials were visiting Europe and the United States, Saigō Takamori served as the caretaker, becoming the second de facto ruler.

description.zh-cn: 西乡隆盛下野后，由大久保利通执政。
description.en: After Saigō Takamori left office, Ōkubo Toshimichi took power.

description.zh-cn: 木户孝允在执政期间实行了“四民平等”政策。
description.en: Kido Takayoshi implemented the policy of 'Equality of the four estates' during his administration.

description.zh-cn: 木户孝允在执政期间实行了“废刀令”。
description.en: Kido Takayoshi implemented the 'Sword Abolition Edict' during his administration.

description.zh-cn: 木户孝允在执政期间实行了“废藩置县”。
description.en: Kido Takayoshi implemented the 'Abolition of the han system and establishment of prefectures' during his administration.

description.zh-cn: 岩仓使节团的出访为西乡隆盛成为留守政府的实质执政者创造了条件。
description.en: The departure of the Iwakura Mission created the conditions for Saigō Takamori to become the de facto ruler of the caretaker government.

description.zh-cn: 因“征韩论”引发的政变导致西乡隆盛下野，离开政府。
description.en: The political turmoil caused by the 'Seikanron' debate led to Saigō Takamori leaving the government.

description.zh-cn: 西乡隆盛是维新十杰的成员之一。
description.en: Saigō Takamori was one of the members of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通是维新十杰的成员之一。
description.en: Ōkubo Toshimichi was one of the members of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 木户孝允是维新十杰的成员之一。
description.en: Kido Takayoshi was one of the members of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 小松带刀是维新十杰的成员之一。
description.en: Komatsu Tatewaki was one of the members of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 大村益次郎是维新十杰的成员之一。
description.en: Ōmura Masujirō was one of the members of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 前原一诚是维新十杰的成员之一。
description.en: Maehara Issei was one of the members of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 广泽真臣是维新十杰的成员之一。
description.en: Hirosawa Saneomi was one of the members of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 江藤新平是维新十杰的成员之一。
description.en: Etō Shinpei was one of the members of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 横井小楠是维新十杰的成员之一。
description.en: Yokoi Shōnan was one of the members of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 岩仓具视是维新十杰的成员之一。
description.en: Iwakura Tomomi was one of the members of the Ten Great Nobles of the Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 伊藤博文是长州五杰的成员之一。
description.en: Itō Hirobumi was one of the members of the Chōshū Five.

description.zh-cn: 山尾庸三是长州五杰的成员之一。
description.en: Yamao Yōzō was one of the members of the Chōshū Five.

description.zh-cn: 井上胜是长州五杰的成员之一。
description.en: Inoue Masaru was one of the members of the Chōshū Five.

description.zh-cn: 井上馨是长州五杰的成员之一。
description.en: Inoue Kaoru was one of the members of the Chōshū Five.

description.zh-cn: 远藤谨助是长州五杰的成员之一。
description.en: Endō Kinsuke was one of the members of the Chōshū Five.
